VIM introduces tools for visualization of missing values. Forthermore, methods
to impute missing values and visualizing imputed values are featured.

### Visualize missing values

```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>",
  fig.width = 7,
  fig.height = 5,
  fig.align = "center"
)
```

```{r setup, message=FALSE}
library(VIM)
data(sleep)
x <- sleep[, c("Dream", "Sleep")]
head(x)
marginplot(x)
```

### Impute missing values

```{r}
x_imputed <- kNN(x)
```

### Visualize imputed values

```{r}
marginplot(x_imputed, delimiter = "_imp")
```
